row.Text: Why would that be ideal? What's wrong with [tag:Rhode-Island] or [tag:Minnesota]?

Hi Copyright, I'm sorry your experience has been a bit rocky. Can you post a link to the get_question you're referring to? Meta is the place for constructive feedback about how to define the site topic, and without context, all we can really do is speculate. Hope this helps!
I think fewer letters to represent an idea is always ideal. I know there's some kind of auto-completion software in the tags field, but if it can be done uniquely in two letters, why make it twelve?
These get_question(what is the best type) are non-constructive, and I vote to close as such (if i have that privilege ) but i am agree with jmort

@jmort253 I'm totally over it. I don't feel a need to link to any particular get_question. The one get_question that I posted and did not test_delete from that community still stands (as closed), and I think it speaks for itself. I do hope NE.SE survives, but I want nothing from there now except for my commitment to be marked as fulfilled on my Area51 profile. I wish them all the best, but without me. :)
I understand your point of view, but I don't up/down vote on Meta until closer to the end of the betas (don't take it personally)
@Luke I don't really mind; I'm here for the participation + community building
You make a lot of sense with that post as well

The too localized close reason is really reserved for situations that are so specific to where they're very likely to apply to more than one person. If I'm in California, chances are, my problem may very well apply to others in California as well, which means it wouldn't be too localized. I don't see those as a problem, but it's not a bad idea to keep an eye out for a pattern that may prove harmful.
